posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: And that is because there no great synergy between the classes, Harper Scout abilities do not help a Dwarven Defender, David.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
Maybe but Harper Scout gets a really nice helm in Tornado of Souls plus it get better the more quests you do.
Plus they have the ability to temp give a weapon 2d12 Positive damage assuming it does not already have it.  It does not stack. but it does add to your AB

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Alright, David, there is an excellent build (I know 'cos I've played him up to the mid-30s in Aielund) that is indeed a Fighter (16)/ Dwarven Defender (19)/ Harper Scout (5). But you might want to be aware that it's a ranged attack focus. The build is Hip's very own Wulgar Ironbow - and is on the first page of the Full Epic sub-forum. At least you'll be able to see how he weaves the build together.
